articles.headline: Obama Lashes Trump in Debut 2018 Speech. President’s Response: ‘I Fell Asleep.’
articles.snippet: The former president offered a stinging indictment of his successor, sometimes by name, accusing him and his Republican supporters of practicing a “politics of fear and resentment.”
articles.abstract: The former president offered a stinging indictment of his successor, sometimes by name, accusing him and his Republican supporters of practicing a “politics of fear and resentment.”
articles.lead_paragraph: URBANA, Ill. — Former President Barack Obama re-entered the national political debate on Friday with a scathing indictment of President Trump, assailing his successor as a “threat to our democracy” and a demagogue practicing the “politics of fear and resentment.”

articles.headline: Conspiracy Theories Made Alex Jones Very Rich. They May Bring Him Down.
articles.snippet: The Infowars founder and Trump backer is as much marketer as ideological warrior, selling products to assuage the fears he is so expert at stoking.
articles.abstract: The Infowars founder and Trump backer is as much marketer as ideological warrior, selling products to assuage the fears he is so expert at stoking.
articles.lead_paragraph: AUSTIN — More than ever before in his two-decade career built on baseless conspiracy theories, angry nativist rants and end-of-days fearmongering, Alex Jones is being called to account.
articles.byline: By Elizabeth Williamson and Emily Steel

articles.headline: Congressional G.O.P. Agenda Quietly Falls Into Place Even as Trump Steals the Spotlight
articles.snippet: This week has illustrated why Republicans put up with the chaos: As President Trump raged, his party moved toward an ideological shift in the Supreme Court that will last for decades.
articles.abstract: This week has illustrated why Republicans put up with the chaos: As President Trump raged, his party moved toward an ideological shift in the Supreme Court that will last for decades.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — On one end of Pennsylvania Avenue this week, President Trump and his closest advisers labored to beat back perceptions, fueled by an anonymous essay in The New York Times and a bruising new book by Bob Woodward, that he had all but lost control of the presidency from within. He lashed out anew at his attorney general, shouted “TREASON” and demanded investigations of his detractors.

articles.headline: Robots Can Manage Your Money. But Even They Need Humans.
articles.snippet: Betterment, among the largest so-called roboadvisers, is one of the latest online services to reduce even further the cost of advice from a mix of algorithms and warm-blooded professionals.
articles.abstract: Betterment, among the largest so-called roboadvisers, is one of the latest online services to reduce even further the cost of advice from a mix of algorithms and warm-blooded professionals.
articles.lead_paragraph: The robots may need some help from humans after all.

articles.headline: Alibaba’s Jack Ma, China’s Richest Man, to Retire From Company He Co-Founded
articles.snippet: In an interview, Mr. Ma said it was “the beginning of an era” for him and that he planned to focus on philanthropy in education.
articles.abstract: In an interview, Mr. Ma said it was “the beginning of an era” for him and that he planned to focus on philanthropy in education.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Alibaba’s co-founder and executive chairman, Jack Ma, said he planned to step down from the Chinese e-commerce giant on Monday to pursue philanthropy in education, a changing of the guard for the $420 billion internet company.

articles.headline: Harvard Is Vaulting Workers Into the Middle Class With High Pay. Can Anyone Else Follow Its Lead?
articles.snippet: Students forced the university to shield campus workers from outsourcing’s impact on pay. But as a model, the policy challenges some economic axioms.
articles.abstract: Students forced the university to shield campus workers from outsourcing’s impact on pay. But as a model, the policy challenges some economic axioms.
articles.lead_paragraph: Martha Bonilla is not your typical middle-class worker. And it’s not just that she was born in a backwater of El Salvador and crossed Mexico hidden among a pile of bananas in the back of a truck to make her way illegally into the United States at age 20.

articles.headline: Trump Administration Discussed Coup Plans With Rebel Venezuelan Officers
articles.snippet: Venezuelan military officers seeking to overthrow President Nicolás Maduro sought help from the Trump administration, which met with them several times.
articles.abstract: Venezuelan military officers seeking to overthrow President Nicolás Maduro sought help from the Trump administration, which met with them several times.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Trump administration held secret meetings with rebellious military officers from Venezuela over the last year to discuss their plans to overthrow President Nicolás Maduro, according to American officials and a former Venezuelan military commander who participated in the talks.
articles.byline: By Ernesto Londoño and Nicholas Casey

articles.headline: China Is Detaining Muslims in Vast Numbers. The Goal: ‘Transformation.’
articles.snippet: Ethnic Uighurs in vast numbers have been sent to camps as part of a campaign to remove any devotion to Islam, China’s most sweeping internment program since the Mao era.
articles.abstract: Ethnic Uighurs in vast numbers have been sent to camps as part of a campaign to remove any devotion to Islam, China’s most sweeping internment program since the Mao era.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOTAN, China — On the edge of a desert in far western China, an imposing building sits behind a fence topped with barbed wire. Large red characters on the facade urge people to learn Chinese, study law and acquire job skills. Guards make clear that visitors are not welcome.

articles.headline: Manchin Counts on Health Care to Stave Off Republican Tide in West Virginia
articles.snippet: In a heavily pro-Trump state, the Democratic senator has built a lead in polls based, in part, on his support for the Affordable Care Act.
articles.abstract: In a heavily pro-Trump state, the Democratic senator has built a lead in polls based, in part, on his support for the Affordable Care Act.
articles.lead_paragraph: MARMET, W.Va. — There were the beauty queens, ages 6 to 60, riding in style in the Labor Day Parade, including Teen Miss West Virginia Coal. There was the man driving a pickup truck memorial to 29 workers killed in a 2010 mine disaster, each victim’s portrait airbrushed on metal.

articles.headline: Top Trump Adviser Says Ted Cruz Could Lose Texas Senate Race
articles.snippet: Still, Mick Mulvaney, the Office of Management and Budget chief, said Republicans would be able to surmount a Democratic “movement of hate” in November.
articles.abstract: Still, Mick Mulvaney, the Office of Management and Budget chief, said Republicans would be able to surmount a Democratic “movement of hate” in November.
articles.lead_paragraph: A pair of top Republicans acknowledged in a private meeting on Saturday that the party was battling serious vulnerabilities in the midterm elections, including what one described as widespread “hate” for President Trump, and raised the prospect that Senator Ted Cruz of Texas could lose his bid for re-election because he is not seen as “likable” enough.
articles.byline: By Alexander Burns and Kenneth P. Vogel

articles.headline: California Tries New Tack on Gun Violence: Ammunition Control
articles.snippet: The state already has some of the strictest gun control legislation. Now it's pushing to limit the unfettered sale of ammunition.
articles.abstract: The state already has some of the strictest gun control legislation. Now it's pushing to limit the unfettered sale of ammunition.
articles.lead_paragraph: SACRAMENTO — Sold from vending machines in Pennsylvania, feed depots in Nevada, pharmacies in Georgia and jewelry stores in Texas, ammunition is in many states easier to buy than cold medicine. But in California, which already enforces some of the nation’s most restrictive gun laws, there is a movement underway against the unfettered sale of bullets.

articles.headline: Christiane Amanpour Takes the Old ‘Charlie Rose’ Slot on PBS
articles.snippet: With “Amanpour & Company,” a CNN veteran based in London brings a new sensibility to an hour that was once dark and clubby.
articles.abstract: With “Amanpour & Company,” a CNN veteran based in London brings a new sensibility to an hour that was once dark and clubby.
articles.lead_paragraph: Say farewell to the oak table and the darkened room.

articles.headline: CBS Chief Executive Les Moonves Steps Down After Sexual Harassment Claims
articles.snippet: Mr. Moonves had already been negotiating his departure before a report on Sunday detailed new sexual harassment allegations against him.
articles.abstract: Mr. Moonves had already been negotiating his departure before a report on Sunday detailed new sexual harassment allegations against him.
articles.lead_paragraph: Leslie Moonves, the longtime chief executive of the CBS Corporation, stepped down on Sunday night from the company he led for 15 years. His fall from Hollywood’s highest echelon was all but sealed after the publication earlier in the day of new sexual harassment allegations against him.

articles.headline: C.I.A. Drone Mission, Curtailed by Obama, Is Expanded in Africa Under Trump
articles.snippet: The Obama administration had handed off much of the C.I.A.’s deadly drone program to the military. President Trump has eased those limits on secret airstrikes by the agency.
articles.abstract: The Obama administration had handed off much of the C.I.A.’s deadly drone program to the military. President Trump has eased those limits on secret airstrikes by the agency.
articles.lead_paragraph: DIRKOU, Niger — The C.I.A. is poised to conduct secret drone strikes against Qaeda and Islamic State insurgents from a newly expanded air base deep in the Sahara, making aggressive use of powers that were scaled back during the Obama administration and restored by President Trump.
articles.byline: By Joe Penney, Eric Schmitt, Rukmini Callimachi and Christoph Koettl

articles.headline: Volkswagen Trial Offers Hedge Funds a Chance to Settle Old Scores
articles.snippet: Paul Singer’s Elliott Management is funding lawsuits by shareholders who want the automaker to reimburse them for losses caused by the diesel scandal.
articles.abstract: Paul Singer’s Elliott Management is funding lawsuits by shareholders who want the automaker to reimburse them for losses caused by the diesel scandal.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — A decade ago, an epic stock market battle between Volkswagen’s biggest shareholder and a group of mostly American hedge funds ended badly for the investors. Now, for at least one of those funds, it’s payback time.

articles.headline: Pinterest Is a Unicorn. It Just Doesn’t Act Like One.
articles.snippet: The company rejects Silicon Valley’s aggressive, hype-driven way of doing business. But its slow and steady approach has frustrated some investors and employees.
articles.abstract: The company rejects Silicon Valley’s aggressive, hype-driven way of doing business. But its slow and steady approach has frustrated some investors and employees.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Ben Silbermann does not enjoy being interviewed. He isn’t a fan of speaking at tech industry conferences. Nor does he like sitting for glossy magazine portraits. He doesn’t think he should have to explain Pinterest, the web service that allows people to save images to virtual pinboards, to anyone other than those who want to use it.

articles.headline: Abortion Opposition Once Defined Marsha Blackburn. But Not in Her Senate Race.
articles.snippet: The Tennessee Republican is emphasizing a Trump agenda and relegating abortion to the background of her campaign to win the seat being vacated by Bob Corker.
articles.abstract: The Tennessee Republican is emphasizing a Trump agenda and relegating abortion to the background of her campaign to win the seat being vacated by Bob Corker.
articles.lead_paragraph: KINGSPORT, Tenn. — Inside the Kingsport Chamber of Commerce one morning last month, a few dozen voters sipped coffee and listened for 45 minutes to Representative Marsha Blackburn tick off all the reasons that this traditionally Republican stronghold in northeastern Tennessee should support her in one of the most high-stakes Senate races this year.

articles.headline: Trump Claims Credit for the Economy. Not So Fast, Says Obama.
articles.snippet: At stake is more than bragging rights: The expansion is central to President Barack Obama’s legacy, and to President Trump’s political standing.
articles.abstract: At stake is more than bragging rights: The expansion is central to President Barack Obama’s legacy, and to President Trump’s political standing.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The economy is doing quite well, thank you very much, and the president would naturally like to take credit. Both of them.

articles.headline: For Big Tech, a Comeuppance We’ve Seen Before: On Wall St.
articles.snippet: A decade after the financial meltdown, the cloud growing over Silicon Valley is a reminder that trust can be awfully hard to regain once it’s lost.
articles.abstract: A decade after the financial meltdown, the cloud growing over Silicon Valley is a reminder that trust can be awfully hard to regain once it’s lost.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — When I moved to the Bay Area two years ago, it was with a sense of relief.

articles.headline: A Spy Story: Sergei Skripal Was a Little Fish. He Had a Big Enemy.
articles.snippet: Sergei Skripal and Vladimir Putin, Soviet men of the same age, were raised to wage war against the West. After the Soviet Union collapsed, one rose. And one fell.
articles.abstract: Sergei Skripal and Vladimir Putin, Soviet men of the same age, were raised to wage war against the West. After the Soviet Union collapsed, one rose. And one fell.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Sergei V. Skripal was a little fish.
articles.byline: By Michael Schwirtz and Ellen Barry

articles.headline: China Sees Hints of a Past Threat: Inflation
articles.snippet: If it persists, a steady uptick in prices could complicate Beijing’s effort to support economic growth and contend with the trade war with the United States.
articles.abstract: If it persists, a steady uptick in prices could complicate Beijing’s effort to support economic growth and contend with the trade war with the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Pork is up. Vegetables are up. Gasoline is up. Even the official numbers, usually tame, are up.
